faq.question: What is COBKA?
faq.answer: COBKA, short for Central Oregon Beekeepers Association, is a volunteer-run nonprofit supporting beekeeping in Central Oregon. We offer education, mentorship, equipment access, and a community for beekeepers of all experience levels.

faq.question: How can I become a member of COBKA?
faq.answer: Sign up at: https://www.cobeekeeping.org/Become-a-member. Membership includes meeting access, educational resources, and eligibility for equipment loans and scholarships.

faq.question: Does COBKA offer beekeeping courses?
faq.answer: Yes. COBKA provides an annual Beginner Beekeeping Course, at least one advanced class, and hands-on events like hive inspections and field days.

faq.question: What is the Oregon Master Beekeeper (OMB) Program?
faq.answer: Run by Oregon State University (OSU), the OMB Program offers structured beekeeping education at multiple levels. COBKA provides a free one-year membership for OMB participants in Central Oregon and scholarship/reimbursement support for locals enrolled in OMB. Learn more: https://extension.oregonstate.edu/mb

faq.question: How can I sign up for the OSU Oregon Master Beekeeper Program?
faq.answer: Register through OSU: https://extension.oregonstate.edu/mb. COBKA members in Central Oregon may qualify for reimbursement‚Äîsee our scholarship info.

faq.question: How do I report a bee swarm?
faq.answer: Report honey bee swarms here: https://www.cobeekeeping.org/Swarm-Page. A local beekeeper may safely remove and relocate them‚Äîfree of charge, if they‚Äôre honey bees.

faq.question: Are there local suppliers for beekeeping equipment in Central Oregon?
faq.answer: Yes! COBKA maintains a supplier list here: https://www.cobeekeeping.org/Suppliers. Contact us if you'd like to suggest a local supplier.

faq.question: How many hives can I keep in Bend, Oregon?
faq.answer: Depends on lot size: Under 5,000 sq. ft. ‚Üí 2 hives max; 5,000‚Äì10,000 sq. ft. ‚Üí 4 hives max; Over 10,000 sq. ft. ‚Üí 6 hives max. Regulations: https://bend.municipal.codes/BDC/3.6.300

faq.question: Do I need to register my hives?
faq.answer: Yes, if you have 5 or more colonies, register annually with the Oregon Department of Agriculture. Form: https://www.oregon.gov/oda/shared/Documents/Publications/IPPM/ApiaryRegistrationForm.pdf. Details: https://www.oregon.gov/oda/programs/IPPM/InsectsSpiders/Pages/BeesApiaries.aspx

faq.question: What are the rules for selling honey in Oregon?
faq.answer: Key requirements include: Accurate honey labeling (ORS 616.766), Oregon Produce Standards, and compliance with ODA Food Safety guidelines. For details, check: https://www.oregon.gov/oda

faq.question: How can I get beekeeping help?
faq.answer: Use our Ask a Master Beekeeper service: https://www.cobeekeeping.org/Ask-a-Master-Beekeeper. Choose Public Q&A (published on our website) or Private reply via email. Confirmation is sent after submission.

faq.question: How do I check my hives for Varroa mites?
faq.answer: Common methods include Alcohol Wash (most accurate), Sugar Roll (less invasive), and Sticky Boards (long-term monitoring). Guide: https://honeybeehealthcoalition.org/varroatool/

faq.question: What should I do if my hive dies?
faq.answer: Conduct a Hive Necropsy: preserve the frame layout, freeze a bee sample, and log recent activity (mite levels, feeding, etc.). This helps diagnose the issue and prevent future losses.
